title: Grow Your Own Grains Part 1: Best Seeding Methods -- Low Tech Video No. 24

tasks.task: Preparing the soil and planting oats, barley, and field peas
subtasks: Knocking down the previous year's vegetation
Disking the topsoil to a depth of an inch or two
Spreading horse manure and composted horse manure on the field
Tilling the soil again to incorporate the manure.
Planting seeds using a single-row seeder
Marking rows every eight inches for planting
Modifying sealing discs to achieve the desired seeding rate
Broadcasting seeds in straight rows for better weed management
Ensuring a proper seeding depth of three-quarters of an inch to an inch

tasks.task: MAINTASK: Preparing the soil and planting oats, barley, and field peas
subtasks: Knocking down the previous year's vegetation (disking the topsoil)
Spreading horse manure and composted horse manure on the field
Tilling the soil again to incorporate the manure
Planting seeds using a single-row seeder, adjusting seeding discs for rate
Marking rows every eight inches for precise planting
Ensuring a proper seeding depth of three-quarters to one inch
